p:
Chebulagic acid and punicalagin as tannins demonstrated an entry-inhibitor effect to HSV-1 ( Chang et al., 2004). These hydrolyzable tannins inhibited viral entry phase, including attachment and penetration, thereby showing anti-RSV effects ( Lin et al., 2013). New antiviral chromone glycosides (Uncinoside A) ( Ma et al., 2003), biflavonoid (Genkwanol) ( Huang et al., 2010), and flavone ( Wang et al., 2012) protected against RSV with an unclear mechanism and resveratrol by reducing RSV-induced Inflammation through down-regulation of IFNÎ³ levels ( Zang et al., 2011).
Figure 1 also displays the mechanistic pathways which are blocked by natural products.
